summary: In the Season 2 premiere, tensions run high as Penny's first surgery approaches. Later, a family trip to the pumpkin patch lifts Penny's spirits, but fear sets in the night before her procedure.
The day of Penny's spinal-decompression surgery has arrived, leading Terra and Joe to worry as they head to the hospital. Later, complications could stall the procedure before it even begins.

Joe wants to surprise Terra for Penny's homecoming following her first surgery, but an early release could spoil his plan. Later, Joe and Terra have their first experience with suppositories as Penny's recovery begins.

Terra confronts Tonya about not visiting Penny while she was in the hospital; and Joe doesn't react the way that Terra hoped he would when she brings up having another baby. Later, Terra accompanies Traci to her Ultrasound appointment, where they receive shocking news.
Joe's left in charge of Penny for the first time while Terra throws Traci's baby shower. Later, Joe becomes angry with Terra when she discusses intimate details of their relationship at the party.

Terra's releasing a children's album to expand her brand and wants Joe to be included in the video shoot, but she worries that he won't make it back from his band's performance in Arizona in time to participate.

Joe plans a camping trip to get away for a few nights alone with Terra, but she is nervous about being away from Penny for the first time. She reluctantly agrees to leave her with nanny Olevia and hatches a plan to convince Joe to have another child.
Terra and Joe cut short their camping trip when nanny Olevia stops answering their phone calls and they become worried about Penny.
Terra convinces Joe to start practicing yoga to help relieve his back pain. Later, Joe's visit to the doctor ends with news that may jeopardize their plan to try for another baby.
Terra's upcoming performance to promote her new children's album prompts Joe to make a bet with her that his band's gig at a bar will have a better turnout than her showcase.

The pregnancy of Terra Jolé of "Little Women: LA" is documented in this series, which begins with Terra and Joe receiving disturbing news about their unborn child's health. As a result, Terra undergoes medical tests. Later, the doctor makes a surprising decision about her due date.
Terra asks her mother to fly out for the baby's birth; and Joe finally asks Terra to marry him.

Terra reunites with her besties Traci and Tonya to tell them about Joe's big proposal. Terra and Joe try their hardest to get everything in order before the baby arrives, but when a very pregnant Terra realizes they're not totally ready for the baby, she has a break down.

Tonya gives Terra some mommy advice to ease her nerves. With the final countdown upon them, Joe and Terra celebrate their last night alone together and anticipate how their lives will change as they set off on their new journey as parents.

Terra experiences a meltdown in her hospital room before her surgery begins. After the birth, the baby is rushed to the neonatal intensive-care unit for treatment. Later, Terra and Joe decide upon a name for the baby.
Terra and Joe adjust to life at home with a baby and take their daughter to her first pediatrician appointment to help understand the challenges she may face.

Terra worries about taking Penny to see a neurologist and struggles with her new role as mom. Meanwhile, Joe hopes a visit from his cousin Sonny will lend a helping hand, but after their task to buy a car becomes an afternoon at a bar, Terra realizes she may need professional help.

Terra convinces Joe to make a get-fit pact when she realizes she still doesn't fit into any of her pre-maternity clothes; Joe reflects on all the surgeries he endured as a child and hopes Penny's impending genetics test results won't reveal a similar fate.
Terra and Joe receive the long-awaited news of Penny's genetic test results. Meanwhile, the exhausted new parents prepare to host a Sip 'n See party for friends to meet Penny.
Joe feels pressure to make Terra's first Mother's Day a success, but Penny requires 24-hour care and an exhausted Terra begs Joe to watch Penny all by himself for the afternoon.

Terra makes it to the semi-finals of "Dancing With the Stars," but multiple health issues and waning support from friends increases the pressure. Later, Christy preps for a cutting-edge surgery that has never been performed on a little person; and Elena, Tonya and Briana go to a comedy show that ends in tears.

Briana worries she might have postpartum depression; and Christy's recovery is even harder than anticipated. Later, Terra wishes she was back in the ballroom and struggles to fulfill her promises of making her family, friends and health a priority.

After a tough pregnancy, Jasmine's delivery isn't as easy as she hoped; and Briana is rushed to the hospital with severe pain. Later, Elena and Terra have not spoken to each other in over a month, but the pair go ice skating in hopes of making amends.

Terra throws a vision-board party and confronts Briana about rumors that she tried to steal Terra's manager. Later, Jasmine and Elena are approached by Briana's friend Lisa; and Tonya and Kerwin argue about the expectations they have for each other.

The genetics results to determine if Elena's twins have dwarfism are revealed. Later, Lisa tells Briana that Matt's behavior makes her feel uncomfortable, but Matt spins the blame back on her; Jasmine and Elena end up in the middle of Briana's mess; and the group go to Monster Jam.

Terra and Tonya rally at the L.A. Women's March, but Briana bails because she thinks Terra is going for the wrong reasons. Later, Christy and Todd seek medical weight-loss advice; Elena gets heartbreaking news and heads to Russia to be with her family; and Tonya lashes out over the legitimacy of Mary's couture line.

Terra belittles Briana in front of the gals. Later, Elena criticizes Mary's couture-clothing designs; Briana tries to advance her modeling career by setting up a boudoir photo shoot; and Terra invites the ladies to the Sexual Health Expo, where Briana accuses Jasmine of joining Terra's clique rather than acting as a true friend to her.

Mary holds runway auditions for her London fashion show, where Elena says she's not authentic; Terra regrets inviting both ladies to an upcoming art show; Briana sees photos from her racy photo shoot; Christy and Todd receive his pre-op test results; and Briana arranges a lunch to ease tension with Jasmine, but it backfires as Jasmine is ready to end their friendship altogether.

Terra's dream of writing a book is becoming real as she meets with her editor for the first time, but not everyone is happy for her; Elena thinks Terra doesn't make her family her first priority and questions making her the godmother to her twin boys; and Briana is accused of shady business practices by Christy and finds out Maverick may need an invasive surgery.

In the fifth-season opener, Elena hosts a spa day for the ladies, but Briana doesn't show up, so her friends worry about her; and Christy and Terra remain at odds over the tea incident. Later, Joe reveals how he really feels about Christy.

Christy feels left out following a tense spa retreat; the ladies attend a drag-queen convention; and Terra receives big news at her OBGYN appointment. Later, the group wonders about Briana's whereabouts.

Briana deals with the emotional trauma of her near-death experience after spending eight days in the hospital. Later, Christy faces the consequences of betraying Briana; Tonya and Kerwin move in together; and Jasmine shares news related to her health.

Jasmine hosts Briana's baby shower but has doubts about how many guests will show up in light of Briana's feud with the other ladies. Later, Christy considers reconciling with Briana; Tonya's past with Jaa resurfaces; and Elena's rushed to the hospital when her blood pressure skyrockets.

Elena's released from the hospital after giving birth, but her twins remain in the NICU. Later, Christy's daughter is rushed to the hospital; Terra worries about Tonya's logo for her new active-wear clothing line; and Kerwin gives Tonya an ultimatum, demanding that she cut business ties with her ex-boyfriend.

Tonya's plan to prove to Kerwin that she doesn't have feelings for her ex backfires. Later, Elena's twins are released from the hospital; and Tonya invites the ladies to build houses for charity, but drama between them threatens to derail the event.

Tonya plans a Western-themed party for Kerwin. Later, Terra learns she's not invited to the bash, leading her to arrange a secret meeting with Tonya's daughter; and Briana blames Christy when she ends up in legal trouble.

Briana suspects Christy's involvement in her legal troubles and wonders about her sobriety. Later, Terra reveals secrets that Tonya's daughter told her; Jasmine voices her opinion about Matt's infidelity; and Matt and Briana head to the hospital after another health scare.

Briana recovers from her difficult pregnancy while her baby's monitored in the NICU. Later, Elena and Terra plan a murder-mystery party; the ladies wonder about Christy's involvement in Briana's legal troubles; and Terra takes a risk for an opportunity.
Terra goes dancing with a friend from New York; and Jasmine confronts Christy about meddling with Briana's life. Later, Christy shows up at Tonya's photo shoot with an unexpected visitor.

In the Season 4 premiere, Jasmine hosts a party for the women to share tips about raising kids, but Elena's left off the guest list because she's not a mom. Later, Briana and Matt have relationship issues; and Tonya takes the ladies to a Motocross race that ends in chaos.

Elena has a preview party to test her new beauty products, but Jasmine becomes angry when she's left off the guest list. Elsewhere, an unexpected family member goes behind Briana's back and asks Terra and Christy to help bring her back to the family.

Briana's family reaches out in hopes of reconciling, but Matt insists their children will never meet her family. Elsewhere, Elena decides to tell Preston she wants to try for a baby; Jasmine may need to move out of the state so her husband can find a job; and Tonya gets vocal with Briana about Matt's mind games when the girls go apple picking.

Tonya's daughter's father visits Los Angeles; Christy is concerned Todd being overweight may affect their chances of adopting a child; and Jasmine debates whether to try for a second baby. Meanwhile, Briana keeps a huge secret from Matt.

Jasmine throws a couples party in hopes of pleasing Elena; Tonya feels like she's being left out because of her complicated relationship; and Briana and Christy try to mend their friendship. Later, Terra and Tonya get in a huge fight when Tonya puts a man before her friend.

The ladies wonder if they've lost a friend after Terra's fight with Tonya and Elena. Later, Christy gathers everyone for a day of pizza-making; and Elena receives unexpected news that will change her life.

Jasmine offers to throw Briana a bachelorette party, but she wants Briana to invite all the ladies; Terra and Tonya make amends; Tonya learns she needs to undergo surgery; and Elena finds out she's pregnant. Later, Christy hosts a housewarming party, but an unexpected guest puts a damper on the evening.

The ladies go to Cancún for Briana's bachelorette party; Elena struggles to keep her pregnancy a secret; and Briana becomes upset after realizing Tonya and Terra still don't approve of her relationship with Matt. Later, Christy hires a stripper, causing Briana to have a meltdown.

Briana's bachelorette party in Mexico continues, but the ladies can't enjoy the trip due to Briana's skepticism of who supports her marriage. Later, Terra learns that Ali told Briana she and Tonya don't want to be there; and Christy's called out for acting two-faced.

Terra invites the ladies to go country-line dancing after Briana continues to ignore her apologies. Later, Briana makes a shocking announcement; and Terra and Christy end up in a fight that could tear the group apart.

Season 3 begins with the ladies going on a wine safari tour that quickly turns sour. Briana and Terra introduce new friends, Jasmine and Brittney, to the group, unaware that their paths have crossed with several of the girls before. Meanwhile, Christy and Todd move forward with their plans for in vitro fertilization; and Briana tries to rekindle a relationship with Matt.

Jasmine wants to win the girls over by hosting an extravagant party, but her husband's recent unemployment threatens to disrupt her plans. Meanwhile, Christy undergoes a painful IVF procedure; and Terra reveals a shocking secret that could permanently destroy a relationship.

Briana takes Jasmine to Seattle to meet Matt; Christy and Todd struggle with intimacy when the IVF process puts pressure on their relationship; Brittney's dad throws a "Leaving the Nest" barbecue for her; Jasmine confronts Tonya about problems from their past.

Christy and Todd's anniversary party turns sour when Christy's mother learns of their pregnancy plans. Meanwhile, Elena discloses the dirty details of her relationship with David to Preston; and Tonya throws a graduation party for her daughter.

Brittney flirts with a guy who has boyfriend potential; Briana takes her relationship with Matt to the next level; Tonya lays her heart on the line and talks to Jaa about marriage; Christy struggles with the physical and emotional pain of IVF; Tonya and Terra bring everyone together for a fun beach bonfire, but things quickly heat up as issues from the past are brought to the surface.

Briana gets a life-changing opportunity to sign with a music agent, but when she's put to the test with music producer Kerry Gordy her vocal talent comes into question. Meanwhile, Christy is recruited to do a comedy music video, but she must get Terra and the other girls to participate.

Briana confronts Terra about how unkind she is to Matt. Terra is shocked, and she and the girls decide that Briana's relationship with Matt is unhealthy. Meanwhile, Elena and Preston make a surprise announcement; and Tonya creates a workout routine to help little people stay in shape.

Christy and Todd undergo an artificial insemination procedure and receive their pregnancy test results; Elena plans a special event; Briana learns she was the target of trash talk; tempers flare on the set of Tonya's workout video and they threaten to shut down the project.

Christy seeks medical advice for her excruciating neck pain. Unfortunately, the threat of additional surgery brings up horrible memories of physical abuse from a previous relationship many years ago. Meanwhile, Briana takes the next step in her music career by working with producers and songwriters on her debut single; and a group trip to the horse track results in the ladies confronting Briana about why she flaked out on Tonya's workout video.

The women bust out the bikinis and booze to celebrate Elena's upcoming vow renewal with the bachelorette party she never had. As the girls play steamy bachelorette party games, Brittney surprises the girls when she breaks down over her ex-boyfriend. Meanwhile, Briana drops the mother of all secrets that could cause a major rift between the ladies forever.

Season 2 begins with the ladies embarking on a booze cruise but it's far from smooth sailing. Meanwhile, Traci accuses Briana of lying about why she didn't attend Traci's wedding; Terra gets an offer that could change her career; and a pregnancy test comes up positive for one lucky lady.

Tonya learns that Brianna and Trevore have been talking behind her back, which leads to an explosive lunch with Trevore and his mom. When Brianna learns her daughter is being bullied, she struggles with whether to tell her she is a little person.
Christy and Brianna question Terra's motivations and friendships with other women. Meanwhile, Traci struggles with envy; and Elena's burlesque performance exposes her trust issues with her husband.

Traci and Tonya begin to question Terra's loyalty; Traci gets the news she's been dreaming of; Briana takes a chance on a guy she met online; Christy hosts a barbecue where some of the secrets she's been spreading around the group come back to haunt her.

Terra's brother visits and he forces her to tell their mother that she is pregnant. Meanwhile, Briana confronts her family on why they aren't willing to meet her new long-distance boyfriend; and she goes on stage to sing at an open mic night.

Christy and Todd face unfortunate news and decide to explore alternative options for having a child; Elena decides to have an uncommon cosmetic enhancement; Terra tries to hook up Tonya with a new man by throwing a "Used-Date Party."
The ladies try to mend their relationships after Tonya's "Used-Date Party" ends in a nasty brawl; Christy, Briana and Lila bring the girls together for a fun race; Lila throws a cocktail party.
Terra treats the gang to a weekend on Catalina Island, but the news that they'll be roughing it on this vacation turns half the group into extremely unhappy campers.
Christy and Todd explore IVF after months of trying to get pregnant; Briana invites the girls to see a friend's comedy show; Elena throws a housewarming party that quickly turns ugly.
The ladies visit New Orleans with their husbands and embrace the Big Easy lifestyle, but tempers flare when Briana's desire to see a psychic infuriates Tonya.

The lives of a group of girlfriends who happen to be little people are chronicled. In the opener, the ladies enroll in a sexy dance class and celebrate the end of a marriage. Meanwhile, one gal drops some hints to her boyfriend that she wants to get married.

Christy shops for an engagement ring, even though Todd hasn't yet proposed. Meanwhile, the ladies prepare for a pinup-themed photo shoot; Traci reveals her wedding date; and Elena shares an emotional story about growing up as a little person in Russia.

Christy and Traci's bridal battle intensifies when Christy steals Traci's spotlight at a wine-tasting party. Meanwhile, Elena visits a doctor to find out what type of dwarfism she has and what potential problems might arise during pregnancy. Later, Traci invites the ladies to help her pick the perfect wedding gown, but the occasion gets heated when their tastes clash.
Christy discovers that she may be pregnant; Briana confronts her ex-husband about his new girlfriend; Tonya and Briana go speed dating; Terra and Tonya prepare for a stage performance.

The ladies attend a cooking class and discuss Tonya's love life. Meanwhile, Christy and Todd prepare for their wedding by dieting and enrolling in dance lessons; and Terra plans an intimate evening with Joe, after he fawns over Elena.
Elena considers getting breast implants; Terra tries to get the ladies to appear in a music video.

The ladies attend a wedding convention, where brides-to-be Traci and Christy start a bridal battle. Meanwhile, Elena discusses the possibility that she will have a baby who is a little person; and Terra tells Tonya that the man she's seeing might not be the good guy she thinks he is.
The ladies visit Las Vegas, and attend Traci and Christy's bachelorette parties. Later, the men arrive, and Christy tries to get Todd to elope.

Season 1 ends with Christy finalizing last-minute wedding details. Meanwhile, Terra and Joe feel pressure to discuss the future of their relationship; and the ladies suspect that Elena may be pregnant since she isn't drinking.

In the Season 2 premiere, Jason surprises the group with his new love interest; one of the ladies reveals that she's pregnant; and Jazmin's husband makes an announcement that starts a family feud. Later, an unexpected guest sends Lila over the edge.
Jazmin confronts Dawn about being a disappointing sister-in-law during an evening of belly dancing. Meanwhile, one of the ladies learns shocking news about her baby.
Dawn and Jazmin continue to drift apart; and Jason's attempt to plan a peaceful weekend for the group backfires. Later, a shocking secret is revealed that puts someone in danger.
The group is finally introduced to Katie's boyfriend. Later, the ladies' concern about the health of Katie and her baby leads to a dramatic confrontation during a visit to a pumpkin patch.
Dawn and David dig up details about the past, leading to explosive drama. Later, Jason makes a confession to DJ; and an unwelcome visitor crashes Katie's baby shower.
DJ asks Jason to move in with him; and Dawn learns about Lila's scandalous love life. Later, Lila and Dawn confront Katie about PJ.
In the second-season finale, baby Kinzley is born. Later, Dawn reveals one of Lila's deepest secrets to the others without her consent; and Jazmin must make a difficult decision.

The lives of a group of girlfriends living in New York City who happen to be little people are chronicled. In the opener, Elena visits Lila and meets the rest of the crew, but when she brings up a taboo topic Kristin has a panic attack.

Jason asks Jordanna and Kristin to help him talk to his parents about a sensitive issue; Jordanna confronts Lila for telling Elena about Kristin's divorce; Dawn makes unwelcome comments about Misty and Kristin's new apartment.
Jordanna invites Jazmin and the other ladies to perform in a burlesque show for her company, but Dawn tells Jazmin she shouldn't dance in the show because it's degrading.

Jordanna discovers a softer side to Dawn when they discuss her boyfriend and the problems they've been having. Meanwhile, Misty and Kristin invite the group to celebrate Mardi Gras; and Lila is tempted to break her sobriety when she is surrounded by her partying friends.

Christy McGinty from "Little Women: LA" gets Dawn and Jazmin to stage an intervention for Lila and confront her about her recent drinking. Meanwhile, Jordanna gets some bad news about her Broadway show; and Kristin visits a fertility doctor.

The ladies go on a ski trip to the Catskill Mountains where they are surrounded by friends who are partying and drinking, which causes Lila to struggle with her sobriety. Later, an explosive argument between Jazmin and Dawn leaves one of them in tears.

Misty and Jordanna go to war with each other when they are both asked to walk in a little person fashion show at New York Fashion Week. Jason and Kristin are forced to take sides when Misty and Jordanna fight for an opportunity to walk in the Paris fashion show later in the year.

Dawn asks her friends to help her host an art auction that will raise money for a women's charity in New York. She asks the group to create paintings of "lady parts" that Jason will then auction at the event. At the party, Jason and Jordanna get into an argument when he tries to auction her painting for $5.

Jazmin invites the group to go with her to Puerto Rico, but drama follows. Meanwhile, Dawn confronts Kristin for making nasty comments about her charity auction; and Jason and Jordanna's beef continues and comes to a climax during a day out on the water.

Season 1 ends with tension escalating between Misty and the rest of the group. Meanwhile, Kristin's mounting anxiety over her upcoming 38th birthday hits a fever pitch as the rest of the group tries to comfort her by throwing her an enormous '20s themed birthday bash; and Kristin's boyfriend unexpectedly shows up at the last minute.
In the Season 2 opener, Jack persuades Shannon, a former team member, to rejoin their ranks. Later, Jordan and Fletch get acquainted with the new girls over cocktails.

An attractive early morning sunbather makes an impression on the guys, and Bohdi is a big help in finding a place to stay for a grateful Cassidy and Ariel. Meanwhile, lifeguards rescue a surprising tourist and the crew welcomes a newbie.
This adult series follows the sultry affairs of South Beach lifeguards.
Ariel, Cassidy and Haley hatch a plan to get back at Roxanne; and Fletch comes up short on a sports bet with a California girl. Later, Roxanne secretly shoots a celebrity couple in a sexy moment.
The guys turn to their muscular trainer in an attempt to get back at Roxanne; a comely bartender gives Bohdi a hands-on lesson on how to properly do body shots.
Roxanne is fired over intimate Internet photos; a rock star takes a shine to Bohdi.
Cassidy gets a workout with her personal trainer; Roxanne and Zach celebrate when her new blog proves a success.
Security catches Haley sneaking in to The Dirty, while the lifeguards bend over backwards to help with Melania's Limbo Love-In. Later, Shannon's boyfriend pays a surprise visit.
Jordan plays house with a lovely French maid; Bohdi catches Dylan at an inopportune moment; Roxanne spends a wild night with a drug dealer.
Jordan recalls a steamy night with a stalker in a trench coat; Bohdi informs Dylan that he's rejoining the pro-surfing tour; Haley and Caitlin have a hot time in a tanning bed.
The Miami lifeguards have a new addition to their team, a blonde, virgin bombshell named Brooke. Lana seduces Jace, and comes up with a devious plan.
Cale asks Brooke to go out with him and is turned down but Jace comes to the rescue with two hot tourists. Melanie meets up with her ex-girlfriend for a night time rendezvous.
A jellyfish stings an attractive young lady, and Jace and Cale come to her rescue; Amber is on board for a rendezvous with rapper C-Train.
Lana and a client take Tantric sex to a new level; Keith attempts to loosen up Brooke and play middleman for her and Melanie; Amber hooks up C-Train with a couple of young hotties.
Jace's attractive sister visits and Brady likes what he sees; Brooke joins the lifeguard sisterhood; an unsuspecting Chloe is pimped out by Amber.
When Lana gets into trouble, she looks to Brooke for help; Chloe formulates a plan of revenge for Amber; a lovely young lady joins Jace for some fun in the tower.
Amber seeks help from Melanie; Cale is disappointed to learn that Jace hooked up with Michelle and Tracy; Chloe puts the moves on C-Train.
A vengeful Amber targets Chloe; Lana is attracted to Dean; Brooke blows off Cale to spend time with an old girlfriend from boarding school.

Vinny resurfaces and makes tormenting Lana a priority; Cale makes Brooke jealous by putting the moves on Kitty; Amber tries to get back in C-Train's good graces by presenting him with an impressive gift.
A beautiful brunette captures Jace's imagination; Cale and Brooke go on a first date; Dean and Lana make their relationship official.
Sketches include "Another Astronaut Sketch," "Not Particularly Sure," "Maroon President" and "Bathroom Camera."

In the second-season opener, fans set sail for Grand Turk Island with the band, and five groups of passengers share the dreams they hope will come true on this cruise.

Joey and a fan bond over missing their proms during a 1980s theme night; an attempt is made to lure Donnie to a cabin; and a comedian tries to bypass security and invite the New Kids on the Block to her comedy show.

The guys feel exhausted prior to their big cruise concert, so rehearsal is a struggle; a fan gets nervous before spending some one-on-one time with Jordan; a woman plots to get her neck brace signed by Joey.
Jenny McCarthy's radio show is broadcast from the boat; Donnie bonds too much with a male fan; a singing rehearsal with Joey doesn't go well for a fan; the New Kids on the Block host a toga party.
The boat docks at Grand Turk and a pool party gets underway; Joey goes surfing; Jordan rides ATVs; Jon goes go zip-lining with a fan who's not fond of heights.
TV Night gets wild when Donnie and Joey strip off their costumes; Danny pays tribute to his mom; tension builds between two fans who are sisters.
Donnie tries to break a world record for selfies; fans eagerly seek Jordan's attendance at a party; a woman threatens to skip her sister's performance with Joey.
Libby's comedy show looms, and she's anxious about whether Joey Mac will be there; a fan has an unexpected encounter with a New Kid on the Block, but her pals aren't present to revel in it with her.
A surprise party is held; Augie seeks Johnny's help in getting Jess a special moment with Donnie.
In the second-season finale, the final night of the cruise arrives and Jess receives VIP treatment.
Three thousand fans of New Kids on the Block board a cruise to Bermuda with boy band in the series premiere of this reality show spotlighting the antics of devoted fans and the pop stars they adore.
Donnie has an afterparty following the masquerade ball, and two fans scheme to attend it; a bride-to-be must tend to her hapless bridesmaids.
A bride-to-be goes too far with her demands for her bridesmaids; some eager fans plan to dress as waiters so they can sneak into the New Kids' cabins.
Photo ops are held for the fans, but the event does not go well for the Bikini Sisters; a mishap occurs when Amanda attempts to get close to Donnie.
The New Kids on the Block perform in a concert; a single mother has the time of her life; an embarrassed fan refuses to leave her room after offending Danny.
A Cowboy-Up party is held and things get rowdy; two ladies capture Donnie's attention; a group of single mothers let loose; a fan from Seattle gets to dance with someone special.
The ship docks in Bermuda, and a group miss their ride back; the Bikini Sisters meet their rival; the Single Moms take some perilous risks; and Amanda gets a surprise.
A bride's wedding day arrives, but she's unsure if the New Kids on the Block will be attending the event; Amanda's wishes come true when she has an encounter with the band.
In the first-season finale, the cruise comes to an end and the fans say their farewells; a group of fans from Seattle experience an unforgettable surprise.

The murder of a star quarterback at a crowded club is investigated in the Season 3 premiere. Also: D.A. Mario Siletti's career and marriage are jeopardized when he's involved in a car accident; and Hildy's future is threatened by an untimely diagnosis.

An anonymous tip surfaces, forcing Terry into the case of an officer-involved shooting. Also: The hunt continues for the suspect in the Normandy Parker case; Siletti hires a DUI defense attorney; and Hildy gets good news as she and Terry cross a line.

Public pressure rises over the shooting death of an unarmed suspect. Meanwhile, Hildy pursues the fugitive in the Normandy Parker case, and Siletti is advised to reconcile with his wife in a move that could help his case.

Disturbing information surfaces about Normandy Parker and expands the suspect list in his murder. Elsewhere, Siletti battles for his future and sabotages the D.A. who replaced him, and Terry and Hildy must face realities about their hushed romance.

Terry's conspiracy theory gains traction when the prime suspect in the Normandy Parker case is murdered. Elsewhere, a civil lawsuit compounds Siletti's legal troubles and upends his family life, and Hildy tries to move on from Terry by going on a date.
Terry and Hildy worry they've lost a prime suspect to his gangster foes. Meanwhile, Terry explores his true feelings when Hildy dates another, and Siletti prepares for his trial.

A new murder leads Terry and Hildy to revisit a past suspect as the Normandy investigation shifts closer to home. Also, Mario Siletti's trial begins, and Terry and Hildy face harsh truths about their professional and personal lives.

Terry and Hildy struggle to dig up evidence against their new prime suspect. Meanwhile, Terry tries to mend his relationship with Hildy, and the prosecution aggressively proceeds in Siletti's trial by delivering an emotional witness.

A promising new clue is unearthed, giving hope that the Normandy Parker conspiracy can at last be solved. Meanwhile, Siletti goes all out in his push against the very system he championed as district attorney, and Hildy's home life spirals downward.
Terry and Hildy scramble to resolve one of their most puzzling cases. Meanwhile, a grisly new murder hits close to home, and Siletti pays a substantial price. The Season 3 finale.
Terry and Hildy investigate when two students open fire on a school bus in the Season 2 premiere.
A manhunt for a missing shooter proves to be more difficult than anticipated. Meanwhile, Terry is promoted as acting lieutenant, but the greater job responsibilities soon test him.

The city reels from the school-bus tragedy as the newly appointed district attorney promises justice for the victims. Meanwhile, evidence emerges about a cop's death, and the body of a gang member is found.
Raffi has fears that Hildy's continuing murder probe will impact her own case. Meanwhile, a defense team enlists an acclaimed attorney, and emerging evidence suggests that an inspector was murdered.
The pressure is on Terry and Hildy to find a cop killer. Meanwhile, Jamie makes a surprise move in her defense of Dustin; Navarro reunites with his brother; and Raffi receives an anonymous tip.
Jamie digs into Dustin's past. Meanwhile, Terry and Hildy investigate people within their own department, and Suger makes a stunning discovery when someone close to him vanishes.
Terry and Hildy head to Mexico when truths emerge about Navarro. Meanwhile, a fuming Suger prepares for war, and unforeseen developments mark Raffi's investigation into Suger.

Junior reveals new details, possibly giving leverage to Hildy and Terry in their investigation. Meanwhile, the trial of Dustin Maker kicks off with opening statements, and Sugar receives startling information about his sister from a surprising source.
Terry and Hildy's investigation suffers a serious setback. Meanwhile, Raffi's loyalty is questioned, and the stress of the trial takes a toll on Jamie.
Witnesses take the stand in the case against Dustin. Meanwhile, Jamie faces fallout from her tirade, and threats are made against Hildy's family.

When a junkie is murdered in the Tenderloin district, SFPD detectives Terry English and Hildy Mulligan are shocked to discover the case may be related to the city's youngest billionaire, tech genius Erich Blunt. But Terry's ability to focus is troubled as his wife battles stage 4 pancreatic cancer. Just as the inspectors begin closing in on the case, Blunt's beautiful flight attendant is found dead. (C) TNT

As Inspectors Terry English and Hildy Mulligan begin their investigation into the death of Erich Blunt's flight attendant, Cindy Strauss, Terry must also deal with the recent death of his wife and the arrival of his sister-in-law. The investigation takes an unexpected turn when the results of Cindy's autopsy reveal a shocking secret. (C) TNT

The Inspectors search for clues that might link various suspects, including Erich Blunt, to Cindy Strauss' death. Meanwhile, Hildy is confronted by a young witness from a past investigation who worries for his mother's safety after she is physically abused by her new husband. (C) TNT

Despite the advice of his lawyer, Warren Daniels, Erich Blunt escapes for a drug- fueled weekend with his adoring CTO, Ivana West. Meanwhile, Terry and Hildy must deal with the repercussions of Hildy's officer involved shooting. As Hildy confronts the prospect of losing her job, Terry works to help his partner get out of trouble. (C) TNT

To change the world's opinion of him, Erich Blunt takes a lie detector test to prove his innocence. Meanwhile, Hildy and Terry discover that a past suspect's alibi does not check out. They must get to the bottom of this before it unravels their case against Blunt. (C) TNT

Six months have passed and Erich Blunt is put on trial for the murder of his flight attendant. Elsewhere, Terry tries to make amends for his behavior following his wife's death, and Hildy is tempted to rekindle a romance with her former husband.

After a key witness in the Cindy Strauss murder case turns up dead, Terry and Hildy set out to find the truth before it undermines the prosecution's case. Meanwhile, Erich Blunt's famed attorney, Warren Daniels, sees this as an opportunity to prove his client's innocence. (C) TNT

As the trial against Erich Blunt reaches a dramatic conclusion, attorney Warren Daniels considers the bold move of calling his defendant, Blunt, to the stand. Meanwhile, Terry begins to suspect that a previous investigation may have had significant holes that could change everything. After a series of impassioned closing arguments, both sides brace for the final verdict. (C) TNT

In the aftermath of the Blunt verdict, the Homicide Department investigates a new death involving a drug-addicted socialite and her playboy husband. As they pursue that case, Terry and Hildy also discover that key witnesses from the Kevin Neyers case have recanted their original statements. The inspectors must uncover the truth while keeping their investigation a secret from their superiors. (C) TNT

Inspectors English and Mulligan are fully immersed in the tangled web of trying to solve the Kevin Neyers murder. As they investigate possible suspects one by one, they discover a series of shocking secrets on their pursuit of eventual justice. (C) TNT

Ben asks Anthony to help him investigate his youngest daughter's death. In other events, Seth wonders about the meaning of the visions he had during his near-death experience, while his assistant Andrea warns him that shareholders are showing concern aft

Ben and Anthony's murder investigation leads them to a black-market purveyor of surveillance videos; Seth has second thoughts about his purchase of an NFL franchise; Kenny receives a tantalizing gift of which he isn't ready to partake; Inez and Jimmy enlist her gentlemen's club coworker to help pay off his gambling debt; and Bo and Wendy's hobby shop sinks deeper into financial despair.

At the athletic club where his daughter was murdered, Ben meets an entertainment lawyer (Michael Nouri) who tries to persuade him to drop his investigation. Meanwhile, Seth hits the streets searching for meaning in his life; Inez receives an expensive gift from a gentlemen's club client; and Bo leans on Tyler to devote more time to practice on the baseball diamond.

Ben and Anthony lean on a lawyer (Michael Nouri) to get information on Ben's daughter's murder; Seth relocates to an eco-friendly loft and announces his latest plan to benefit L.A.; Kenny befriends a woman (Jenny Mollen) who runs a homeless shelter; Bo goes overboard in his efforts to impress pitching phenom Tyler and his pal Eddie.

Ben has a reunion with his ex-wife (Peggy Lipton), whom he hasn't seen in more than 30 years; Seth is visited by his long-estranged son (Zane Holtz); Bo tries to get his coaching job back and his problems increase when the store is broken into; a rich Englishman (Neil Hopkins) takes a shine to Inez at work; and Jimmy fences stolen goods for his loan shark (Michael McGlone).

Ben's nostalgic reunion with his ex-wife (Peggy Lipton) and her husband (Keith Carradine) takes a serious turn; Seth gets submarined by a tough journalist during a televised interview; Inez's boyfriend's admission stuns her, but not so much that she cancels her romantic getaway to London with her indulgent English suitor. Meanwhile, the hobby-shop dilemma has Bo and his mother at odds.

While Ben's investigation into his daughter's murder continues, his relationship with his ex-wife (Peggy Lipton) deepens; a hotshot televangelist (Patrick Fabian) suggests that he and Seth work together; and Kenny and Tess grow closer. Meanwhile, a pregnant but still boozing Maggie entertains thoughts of drying out, and Wendy grows jealous of Bo's new romance with a local nurse (Ellen Woglom).

Ben's search for Cassie's killer leads him and Anthony to a coke dealer (Tania Raymonde) with whom Cassie was friendly; Bo tries to recover funds that his mother donated to Seth's homeless project. Elsewhere, a power outage traps Seth, Kenny and Bo in Seth's loft; and Jimmy hopes to convince Inez to move with him to Scottsdale, where he's been offered a job at a cousin's automobile dealership.

Ben and Anthony force heroin-addicted Roxanne (Tania Raymonde) to quit cold turkey in hopes that she'll divulge info on Cassie's murder. Elsewhere, Seth sets his sights on the televangelist who's standing in the way of his homeless-city project; and Bo is furious when Lily (Ellen Woglom) tells a girlfriend a little too much about their "special" lovemaking. Rock star Rick Derringer has a cameo as a crackhead guitarist.

In the opener, a Korean man is murdered and Axel lands the case; Kenny and Bebe have a run-in with an attractive woman; and Christine's father falls ill during her 40th birthday party, and much to the dismay of her husband, she decides that they should take in the old man.

A planned remodeling of their bathroom leads to an argument between Christine and Peter; Lou is unhappy and losing patience with his nurse; Axel tries to keep Eddie from mentioning the deaths of Rick and Shin; Mexican authorities snag Cesar.

Christine's new African-American architect makes a positive impression on her; L.A. police intensify their search for Axel's shooter; Ben offers Anthony a chance to record at an exclusive studio; Cesar meets and befriends a young girl on his trip.

Anthony's first taste of the music-producing biz is an eye-opener, as he walks in on a rowdy party that's bursting with drugs and hookers; Kenny's involvement with Inez goes to a new level and he makes some moves that he hopes will solidify his position.

Peter's housing development is threatened by a raging wildfire; Kenny's efforts to have Gustav deported do not go unpunished; Cesar comes to the rescue of a young woman threatened by a gang of Mexican thieves; Ben is forced to deal with the doctor's sudden death.

Megan blames her mother for her parents' separation, so she acts out by sneaking off with Charles; after getting fired by Ben, a furious Anthony reconnects with an old gangster buddy and considers getting back into his former life.

A drug-addled Ben, who continues to be haunted by the Doctor, coerces Anthony into driving him into the desert for a powwow with his shaman; Cesar takes great satisfaction from his first steps on American soil.
Cesar reflects on his past and the incredible, dangerous trek that landed him in Los Angeles; Kenny and Amy's marriage goes from bad to worse, and he contemplates why he ever got involved with Inez.

A new detective arrives in the precinct and immediately riles up things; Ben engineers an attempt to wrest control of his company from his daughter; Eddie lends a hand to a Korean man and discovers a young girl in dire straits.

Cesar scores a job at a car wash; Christine discovers new info on Peter's departure; police question a suspected K-Town rapist; Jules issues Ben an intriguing challenge; Kenny tries to make things right with Amy.
The second season begins with Richard visiting Hollywood and attempting to become a stuntman.
Richard works as a New York City cab driver and as a stand-up comedian.
Richard works as a rodeo clown and tries his hand at paddleboarding.
Richard trains to be a tire changer on a racing pit crew and takes a drive around a racetrack with Mario Andretti.
Richard tries being a barber in Harlem and serves as a test pilot for a new helicopter.
Richard tries his hand at being a cattle rancher in Texas.
Richard works at an animal sanctuary in Hawaii, and then tries to become a snake wrangler in Southern California.
Richard works with a scientist to help build a rocket, and then he tries becoming a bike messenger in San Francisco.
Crash courses in operating America's largest and most dangerous vehicles are undertaken by Richard Hammond. In the opener, Richard learns to drive a M1 Abrams tank in El Paso.
Richard trains to be a lumberjack in Oregon and attempts to operate three tree-harvesting machines.
Richard attempts to operate a compactor, a scraper and a bulldozer at a Denver landfill.
Richard attempts to drive a powerful fire engine at the Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport.
Richard attempts to use a track hoe and a wrecking ball to demolish a house in Orlando.
Richard attempts to operate a crane, a claw and an electromagnet at a Louisiana scrap-metal site.
In the Season 2 premiere, Pete has a chance encounter with famed magician Penn Jillette, who shakes his faith and inspires a questioning Pete to try living with abandon for one night.
Pete decides to spend the day with Leif, who encourages him to be open to the universe, but their carefree attitude is challenged when they find themselves at odds and in trouble with the law.

Pete is abandoned by Artie, but rescued by comedian Bill Burr, who takes pity on him and offers his guest room, and as an unlikely friendship blossoms, Bill encourages Pete to toughen up and embrace his masculine side.
Pete tries to be supportive when a fellow comedian at The Boston gets his big break. Later, he reconnects with Jessica, who encourages him to find a new way to express himself.
Pete reunites with Ali, who takes him on a tour of New York's alternative comedy scene, where they encounter a wide array of comedians and venues over the course of one night.
Pete's decision to organize a benefit for an ailing comedy vet finds him scrambling to put on a good show and facing some hard truths about Artie.
On a trip to NACA, a comedy conference to book college gigs, Pete and Ali clash over the best strategy to appeal to a younger crowd.

In the Season 2 finale, Pete enters a comedy-roast battle to prove to Ali he's got a backbone, but he finds that being mean is harder than it looks, and the fierce competition brings harsh truths to the surface, forcing him to examine his life's priorities.

In the premiere of a comedy about a timid, aspiring comedian whose life is turned upside down by his wife's affair, Pete is consoled and taken in by Artie Lange as he struggles to find his place in the chaotic New York stand-up scene.
Pete gives Artie Lange a ride to Albany, N.Y., and gets to open for the gig he's sharing with T.J. Miller, but winds up going to extremes with a fan to make sure Artie stays clean and sober.

Pete stays at T.J. Miller's place and witnesses a comedian who is always on. Meanwhile, Pete and T.J. go to a yard sale upstate, where Pete forms an unlikely alliance with Jessica's boyfriend, Leif, to get back a prized possession.

Pete hands out flyers for a comedy club in an effort to get stage time, an experience that comes with encounters with disinterested passersby, bonds with other aspiring comedians, a turf war with a rival barker and a pep talk from a veteran comic.
Pete's folks come to New York for his mom's birthday, so he asks Jess to act like nothing's changed, but a tense dinner reveals harsh truths about their relationships as Jess struggles to keep quiet.

Pete is homeless again and facing professional disappointment, so he turns to Artie Lange, who invites him to be on his podcast. Meanwhile, Sarah Silverman takes Pete in as part of her collection of stray comedians and encourages him to find work as an audience "warm-up" act, which leads to a situation where he could make a name for himself.
Pete's warm-up gig on Rachael Ray's show gives him a natural high, but he comes crashing down after a surprise visit from Leif's wife, who pulls him back into the chaos of his separation from Jess.
In the Season 1 finale, Artie Lange tags along with Pete to a baptism after an attempt to cheer him up goes awry, and they both come away with new perspectives on spirituality and sacrifice.
In the Season 3 premiere, a petty sibling rivalry between two brothers escalates and brings chaos to a small Minnesotan community.
Gloria deals with the aftermath of a crime; Vargas makes a move; and Ray and Nikki move on to Plan B.
Gloria revisits her stepfather's past to try and find some answers.
Emmit and Sy try to figure out what they've gotten themselves into; Nikki and Ray track down some collateral; and Gloria learns more about Maurice.
Nikki and Ray's retaliation has consequences for Emmit while Gloria and Winnie start connecting the dots.
Gloria and Winnie get closer to the truth; Emmit tries to make things right; Nikki and Ray prepare for payback; and Varga cleans up a mess.
Gloria tries to work around the system; Nikki finds herself in a familiar place; Varga comes up with an alternative plan; and Emmit goes to dinner.
Nikki struggles to survive; Emmit gets spooked; and Sy joins Varga for tea.
Emmit sits down with Gloria and Nikki negotiates a deal.
Gloria follows the money, Nikki plays a game and Emmit learns a lesson about progress from Varga.
In the second season premiere, a surprising event at a diner disrupts the citizens of a small Minnesota town.
The Gerhardts get an unexpected offer and two surprising murderers try to clean up their mess.
The search for Rye escalates; Lou visits Fargo; and Peggy learns a new theory about the Waffle Hut shooter.
Floyd responds to Kansas City's proposal; Hanzee takes a road trip; and Lou comes to a realization.
Floyd takes action and Charlie tries to prove himself. Also: Peggy and Ed disagree about what to do next and Lou is sidelined during Ronald Reagan's campaign tour.
Lou and Hank try to prevent an altercation; Peggy and Ed defend their choices; and the Gerhardts attempt to get back one of their own.
Lou and Hank investigate in Fargo; the king of breakfast visits Betsy and Molly; Floyd is summoned away; and Bear questions a family member's loyalty.
Hanzee searches for Peggy and Ed while Dodd ends up in unfamiliar territory.
Peggy and Ed follow their plan at the Motor Motel; Lou faces jurisdictional politics; and Hanzee reports to the Gerhardts.
In the season finale, Peggy and Ed try to escape.
A manipulative drifter preys upon a small-town insurance salesman in the opener of this adaptation of the 1996 Coen brothers film.
Molly becomes suspicious of Lester. Meanwhile, Malvo investigates a blackmail plot.
Molly sets a trap. Meanwhile, Gus thinks about coming clean; and Lester returns to work.
Gus tries to fix a mistake. Meanwhile, Molly uncovers a promising lead.
Molly makes an unorthodox decision after Lester has a close call.
Gus and Molly team up. Meanwhile, Malvo puts his master plan into motion.
Malvo seeks answers. Meanwhile, Molly and Gus have a setback in their investigation.
Molly faces pressure to close the case. Meanwhile, things are looking up for Lester.
Lester has an unexpected encounter. Meanwhile, Malvo changes course.
Malvo eyes a new target in the series finale. Elsewhere, Gus pursues a hunch; and Lester manipulates a situation.

In the Season 2 premiere, Emma hopes she can move on with her life after returning to Lakewood, but she's soon haunted by a dream. In other events, an unknown someone threatens to expose Audrey's connection to Piper.
Tension results when Maggie shares too much about Emma's past; Emma tries to control her fears when someone unexpected arrives in town; and Noah investigates a new lead for his podcast.
Emma deals with her father's return; Audrey's stalker graduates from fun and games to murder; and Branson returns to Lakewood, causing Brooke to question his intentions.
Brooke is worried by Jake's disappearance until a gift from him arrives for Kieran's birthday party; and the Lakewood Six explore their subconscious minds.
A loved one's death reverberates; GW High goes into lockdown; and the Lakewood 5 questions whether history is repeating itself.
Emma questions her friendships. In other events, Noah shares his theory about the identity of Piper's accomplice; and takes his investigation further.
Eli takes Emma on an adventure; Noah's relationship with Zoe escalates; and Brooke and Audrey are lured into a trap by the killer.
The killer forces Emma through a gauntlet of not-so-fun games during the Lakewood Days Carnival; and Brooke launches an attack on the entire town.
Emma and Audrey learn why the killer is targeting them; Noah loses something dear to him; and missing evidence is found.
The killer drives a wedge between Audrey and Emma; Maggie and Acosta fear that secrets from their past may be threatening the present; and Noah's feelings for Zoe are used against him.
In the premiere, the murder of a high-school student in the small town of Lakewood conjures memories of a similar murder that occurred 20 years earlier in the community.
The death of another teen raises questions; and leads to a rift between Emma and Audrey. In other events, a podcaster arrives in town to report on the past and present murders.
Emma discovers that her mom is keeping additional secrets; and the killer challenges her to a dangerous game.
A mysterious message sends Emma and Audrey in search of answers.
Emma learns a heartbreaking secret after a scandalous video leak.
The new prime suspect is someone close to Emma.
Emma races to save a friend from the killer's dangerous game of hide-and-seek.
Emma is shaken by another death; and uncovers a secret from the past.
Emma, who doubts that the actual killer has been captured, teams with Piper to find answers at the Halloween dance.
In the Season 1 finale, Emma tries to save a loved one and also learns the identity of the killer.

In the Season 2 premiere, it's years after the horrors of Kappa House, and Dean Munsch buys an abandoned hospital, where she recruits Drs. Brock Holt and Cassidy Cascade, and medical student Zayday Williams, plus the disgraced Chanels. And soon a new killer stalks the facility.

A patient with a horrible ailment checks into the hospital with hopes of a cure, but instead finds a love interest. Meanwhile, Chad arrives hoping to win back Chanel, but uncovers a disturbing secret about Brock; and Munsch has another encounter with the killer and recruits a new special agent to investigate.

Dean Munsch, Denise and the Chanels question Hester about the killer, as well as the sole survivor of the Halloween massacre, while Chad believes Brock to be the culprit and makes a shocking proposal to Chanel. Later, a patient arrives with an incredible disorder that leads Chanel #3 and Cassidy to become closer.

The Green Meanie's latest attack shocks everyone, so Dean Munsch, Denise and Hester plan to catch the killer by throwing a Halloween party in the hospital. Meanwhile, Chanel attempts to contact the killer's latest victim from beyond the grave. Back at the party, another outbreak puts the hospital on alert and Brock and Cassidy jump into action, while another victim falls.

The frightful events of Halloween force Dean Munsch to notify authorities of murders at the Institute, which leads to a surprising influx of new patients. Meanwhile,Chanel is tired of doing dirty work, so she concocts a plan that entails recruiting new patients to join the Chanels. Later, Zayday and Chanel #5 visit a person with ties to the hospital's past; and a new patient's problems have the staff going a bit mad.

To solve a serious shortage, Dean Munsch and Chanel start a blood drive. Meanwhile, Nurse Hoffel's plan for revenge is put in motion; Hester comes up with a way to join the hospital staff; and a jarring revelation about the Green Meanie is uncovered.

Dean Munsch's efforts to grab positive press for the hospital leads to her pitching a risky surgery to Dr. Holt, whose hand is acting stranger than ever. Meanwhile, Chanel #3 forces Cassidy to take a psych test to get to the bottom of his problem; and Nurse Hoffel puts in motion her diabolical plan.

A new patient who has a link to Dean Munsch's past checks into the institute with the intention of winning her back; a jealous Brock further questions his relationship with Chanel; and Chamberlain and Zayday try to learn the origins of the Green Meanie killer.
A visit from their TV idol, Dr. Scarlett Lovin, overwhelms the Chanels, while Hester orders a Green Meanie summit as the murderer(s) trigger a final kill plan.
The Green Meanie triggers a final plan for revenge as Hester boldly moves to secure her future, and Brock performs risky surgery to save Dean Munsch.
A comedy-horror anthology series begins with a tale of a college campus experiencing a rash of murders.
A serial killer continues to stalk members of a sorority.

Chanel's latest project is Hester; Chanel #3 has a confession to make; and Grace and Zayday notice a startling connection between two fellow students. Meanwhile, Denise goes gunning for a Kappa; Dean Munsch appoints a new mascot; and Chad and Earl Grey muster the fraternity to go on a witch hunt for the Red Devil.

Zayday's stunning announcement triggers a diabolical plan from Chanel; Grace and Pete visit a mysterious woman with a Kappa past; and Hester and Chad grow closer. Meanwhile, Denise continues to search for the Red Devil; and Dean Munsch struggles to keep the university open.

Dean Munsch's Halloween announcement impacts the campus and Chanel's plan to throw a pumpkin-patch party to support her presidential campaign. Meanwhile, Grace and Pete put together a search party for a missing friend, which puts them in close contact with the Red Devil; and Chanel #3 and #5 learn how life could be without Chanel.
Chanel makes an unexpected decision in order to remain safe, and as a result, Zayday gains power. Meanwhile, the Kappa Kappa Tau gals hold a slumber party, where something surprising is uncovered.

A shocking event brings Dean Munsch face-to-face with her ex-husband's mistress. Meanwhile, the Kappas use a Ouija board to find out who the Red Devil killer is and wind up communicating with Chanel #2 from beyond the grave, who informs them of a plot against one of their members.

When Grace asks Chanel's help to learn more about KKT's past, she realizes the two may not be so different after all; and Dean Munsch turns "psycho" after being targeted by the Red Devils. Meanwhile, Denise takes over as housemother at Kappa House; and a frightening figure from the past reappears.

Denise spins a ghastly ghost yarn to the fearful Kappas; Chanel is pushed to the breaking point after Hester's shocking announcement; and a familiar face turns up on campus as the Red Devil strikes again.

Chanel goes to Chad's family home for Thanksgiving, where she meets his family, and an uninvited guest wreaks havoc. Meanwhile, Dean Munsch gathers the Kappa House survivors for a dinner during which they throw around accusations about who is the actual killer and meantime, another victim falls.

In the Season 2 premiere, the downward spiral of the heir to a private equity firm in Charlotte begins when his wife is found dead during a party for his father's retirement, and Detective Cornell wastes no time making him a suspect in the case, though it's soon evident that this seemingly perfect family has more than its fair share of skeletons in the closet.

Cornell hones in on Eric following the revelation of an alarming misdeed from his past, so Amanda tries to help him prove that his relationship with Kate was the real thing and turn the detective's attention elsewhere, but the sight of an ex-girlfriend at the police station gives him a sinking feeling that all could be lost.

Eric searches for Liam, Kate's missing assistant whose real identity may have been unknown to her, and wonders about an encounter she had at a seedy motel. Meanwhile, Cornell blindsides Eric with revelations from an ex-girlfriend; and a mysterious woman with possible ties to Liam may have been involved in Kate's death.

Patrick makes a major gaffe at work by failing to cover for Eric, and then finds himself caught in Cornell's investigation. Meanwhile, Eric and Danny have company in their search for Liam; and a devastating betrayal rocks Eric's world.

Cornell's job is in jeopardy after Eric learns the truth about Danny's identity. Meanwhile, revelations about Kate's secrets make Eric unsure whom he can trust; and someone from Kate's past shares a shocking bit of information with Patrick and Eric.

Eric gets a strange visit at his office from someone connected to Kate, but the more he learns about her past only creates more doubt about his inner circle, especially Patrick. Meanwhile, Cornell is blindsided by shocking news from her ex-husband as she continues to struggle with her former partner's murder two years ago, and increasing tension between her and Danny isn't doing her any favors either.
Patrick's reckless behavior and secret sins force the Warners to quickly patch up their differences and save SEG. Meanwhile, Cornell and her ex-husband are racked with guilt over their daughter.

Eric is the last man standing as his family and SEG seem destined to crumble as the mystery surrounding the house at 8686 Mint Hill Drive unravels. Meanwhile, Cornell believes she's on the verge of naming Kate's killer; and Eric finally gains access to Kate's second iPad with Danny's help, but is amazed at what he finds inside.
Eric can't find one person to be honest with him, but he finally comes clean about an event from his past. Meanwhile, the Warners will never be the same after a shocking revelation.
In the Season 2 finale, Patrick's new reality is a major struggle; Danny continues his search for his daughter; and Cornell believes she's found Kate's killer.
Ben becomes the prime suspect in a murder after finding the body of his neighbor's young son, and he and his family are engulfed in a media firestorm after a detective's routine questioning.

Ben starts to conduct his own investigation after learning shocking news about the murder case from Detective Cornell, and the deceased boy's mother suspects his estranged father may be responsible for his death.
Ben struggles to keep his family together after a damaging revelation is made public right before the holidays, but he also discovers a shocking piece of evidence that could tie him to Tom's murder.

Ben learns where Natalie was two nights before Tom died, when she was allegedly babysitting, which leads to a confrontation with his neighbors, the Richardsons, and a revelation about the death of their own son. Meanwhile, Cornell confirms the murder weapon; and Ben's memory continues to fail him about the night of Tom's death.
Ben helps a neighbor's autistic son and discovers another piece of evidence related to Tom's murder, which causes Ben to suspect the boy's family may know more than they're letting on.

Ben's unnerved by a vigilante who's been stalking him, but he rejects any police protection for himself while reluctantly accepting security for his wife and daughters. Staying with his friend Dave, however, isn't the safe haven Ben thought it would be.

Ben talks to a prison inmate and wonders if Cornell is abusing her authority, so he plots to turn the tables on her with an assist from Fenton, but an anonymous tip makes Ben the prime suspect once again, which pushes the Crawfords to their limits.

Ben retraces his steps on the night of Tom's death with help from Dave in a desperate attempt to counter video evidence uncovered by Cornell that could be proof of his guilt. Meanwhile, the Crawfords' marriage continues to disintegrate, and the turmoil is having a devastating impact on their kids; and Ben's lawyer conceives of an alternative theory of the murder.

Ben's discovery in the attic makes his relationship with Christy even more tense as she continues to keep him from seeing the kids, though he does get to spend some time with Abby at a Christmas fair. Meanwhile, Cornell returns to the crime scene looking for clues after a leak at the crime lab makes most of the forensic evidence unusable.

In the Season 1 finale, Ben tries to relax and enjoy the Christmas he missed with his family when he's certain he didn't cause Tom's death, but his plans are changed by a shocking discovery. Meanwhile, Cornell prepares to make an arrest after all the evidence has been retested.
A scientific team is granted access by the Egyptian government to solve a 4,500-year-old mystery involving the Great Pyramid at Giza.
A team of experts seek to locate exactly where Hannibal and his troops crossed the Alps to launch a surprise attack on Rome.
The Season 16 premiere examines a prehistoric English settlement that's shedding new light on the history of the western world.
Scientists attempt to determine what was the apex predator in northern Colombia 58 million years ago. The candidates include Titanoboa, a 43-foot snake, and a giant crocodilian.
Art historian Bernadette Murphy investigates what caused Dutch artist Vincent van Gogh (1853-90) to lop off his ear
Archaeologists map the underwater ruins of what was ancient Rome's version of Las Vegas.
An exploration of whether many of Leonardo da Vinci's ideas were borrowed from other sources.

The Season 15 premiere explores the vampire myth, which-if manuscripts and archaeological evidence are believed-emanated from medieval England. The lore was popularized by Bram Stoker's "Dracula," of course, and still has adherents, including Mirca Mitrica, who recalls taking part in a ritual in 2004 Romania to ensure a possible vampire stayed buried. Also interviewed: Bram Stoker's great-grandnephew Dacre Stoker; and archaeologist Dominic Powlesland, who's uncovered deviant Anglo-Saxon burials.

An investigation of the 1962 escape of three inmates from the infamous Alcatraz prison. It's been long believed that the men were swept out to sea, where they drowned, but scientists now think that they could have made it to land.
An amateur archaeologist searches for Cleopatra's tomb.
Archaeologists explore hidden chambers beneath the ancient Mexican city of Teotihuacán.
The Season 14 premiere details the discovery of skeletal remains of 10 people, including infants, found in the basement of Benjamin Franklin's London home.
The truth behind the story of Troy and the Trojan horse, as described by Homer in "The Illiad," is uncovered by a team of historians, military engineers and archaeologists.

The story of the Jamestown settlement, the first permanent English colony in the Americas, is seen through the prism of a 14-year-old English girl whose skull and severed leg were discovered during the excavation of the trash layer of a cellar. The study of her remains reveals evidence that one or more of the settlers, who endured a 1609-10 winter that's often called the "Starving Time," resorted to the unthinkable-cannibalism-to feed themselves.

George Clooney narrates the Season 13 premiere, which recalls how the JFK assassination was reported by journalists on the scene in Dallas and Walter Cronkite, who anchored CBS News' coverage from New York. Included: the recollections of Dan Rather, Bob Schieffer, Marvin Kalb and Marianne Means; and former president Bill Clinton.

A look at the forensic techniques used to study the lost diary of Dr. David Livingstone (1813-73), the famed explorer. The work reveals that he witnessed a massacre of slaves by slave traders; and that the legend that surrounds him isn't true to the man.
This documentary explores evidence that Carthaginians fleeing the Romans in 146 B.C. landed in South America.

The search for the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World despite a lack of physical evidence that they existed. Dr. Stephanie Dalley (Oxford University) posits that the legendary gardens were not located, as commonly believed, in the ancient city of Babylon, but hundreds of miles to its north, in what's now central Iraq.

An alternate Leonardo da Vinci painting of Mona Lisa that was discovered in 2012 is studied. Art historians, research physicists, restoration experts and forensic-imaging specialists analyze the artwork, which shows a younger, happier Mona Lisa, in an attempt to verify its date and decipher any mathematical codes that may be hidden within it.

Scientists study the bones of King Richard III, the infamous English monarch whose remains were discovered beneath a parking lot in Leicester, England, in 2012. The program explores the possibility that the curvature of his spine would have hindered him in battle.

This episode of the long-running PBS series tells the little-known story of Soviet submarine commander Vasili Arkhipov, who likely averted World War III when he rejected a call to launch a nuclear torpedo while trying to elude U.S. warships during the Cuban Missile Crisis.

The thoughts and opinions of German POWs during World War II are revealed in this installment, which relies on transcripts from an MI19 (British military intelligence) bugging operation that secretly recorded the conversations of 4000 German prisoners. Included: dramatic reenactments based on the transcripts.

An investigation into the 1832 deaths of 57 Irish laborers who were laying railroad tracks in Pennsylvania. Cholera was blamed at the time, but modern forensic science sheds light on what really happened.

The discovery of a tomb of 49,000-year-old Neanderthal bones in a remote region of northern Spain leads to an attempt to learn why this particular Neanderthal group died and, in addition, if their deaths can help explain the extinction of Neanderthals.

Egyptologist Chris Naunton investigates the mysteries that surround Egyptian pharaoh Tutankhamen and his tomb, which went undetected for thousands of years until being discovered by archaeologist Howard Carter in 1922. Included: how Tut died; what happened to his body after mummification; and whether he was buried in a tomb meant for someone else.

Historian Charles Allen attempts to verify or dismiss an 1898 find in northern Indian that many experts have long deemed a hoax: Buddha's bones and ashes. The remains were discovered in an inscribed reliquary jar found buried inside a stone coffer that was found while excavating a hill.

Using evidence from recent archaeological digs, this program takes a fresh look at the mysterious disappearance of celebrated adventurer Colonel Percy Fawcett, who went missing while searching for a city of gold rumored to be hidden deep within the Amazon rainforest.
Archaeologist Agnes Hsu leads the effort to discover the technology that allowed the Chinese to transport 8,000 terracotta warriors more than 2,000 years ago.

As narrated by Liev Schriber, this historically-themed documentary travels back in time to the early 1950s, when the United States and the Soviet Union began a fierce competition with one another to determine who could construct the largest and deadliest bomb. The results were not simply overwhelming but horrifying, culminating with a March 1, 1954 fifteen megaton test (called "Castle Bravo") that vaporized three coral islands, and the Soviets' detonation of a 50-megaton device called the "Tsar Bomb" that sent shock waves around the world. This program tells the story of the early atomic arms race, making fervent use of archival footage to establish context and evoke the said period.

This installment in the Secrets of the Dead documentary series takes a look at the mysterious historical structure of Pharaoh Psusennes' tomb - an archaeological site that has been a source of awe and wonder to historians for years. Deconstructing the tomb's hieroglyphs and contents, the program pieces together who Psusennes was, and why he came to be known as the Silver Pharaoh.

This installment in the Secrets of the Dead documentary series takes a look at the mysterious historical structure of the Meermin - a Dutch slave ship that set sail for South Africa in 1766, only for the slaves aboard to declare mutiny, taking over the vessel and demanding it be turned around and sent back to Madagascar.

This documentary explores an effort by marine archaeologists in 2009 to complete a sonar survey of the ocean floor in an area of Italian islands, only to discover no less than five Roman shipwrecks waiting at the bottom - preserved almost perfectly, and undisturbed by time, with all of their cargo in tact.

500 years after Michelangelo's death, art historian Antonio Forcellino unearths evidence of the prominent artist's involvement with a clandestine fellowship that was attempting to reform the Catholic Church from within. Michelangelo's artwork virtually defined religion for the masses, but was there another side to his religious views? Not only did the group Michelangelo was involved with level damning accusations of corruption against the Catholic Church, they also supported ideas that were considered so heretical they were punishable by death. As Michelangelo attempted to reconcile his views of the church against his personal beliefs regarding salvation, his involvement with the radical group put him at perilous odds with church officials whose power and rulings were absolute.

The story of a WWII U.S. bomber crew that, after its plane was downed over Borneo by Japanese antiaircraft fire, was taken in by the infamous Dakar tribe, which was known for headhunting. The documentary features archival footage and dramatic re-creations as well as remarks from the last surviving crew member, Dan Illerich, members of the Dakar tribe, and historian Judith Heimann, whose book +The Airmen and the Headhunters inspired the program.

Not long after the double terror of September 11, 2001 and July 7.,2005, yet another terrorist horror erupted - this one on November 26, 2008. That day, in Mumbai, India, Pakistani militants seized control of the city and proceeded to drive millions of residents into a waking nightmare - storming through cafes, train stations and five star hotels for nearly sixty hours. Meanwhile, several dramas unfolded concurrently: police frantically tried to pull together a unified and effective response, journalists attempted to cover the situation, hostages inside the hotels began frantically sending twitter and text messages out to loved ones, and - perhaps most disturbingly - the Pakistani terrorist coordinators used the media coverage to relay information about victims' whereabouts to their operatives and increase the breadth and severity of the massacre at hand. This documentary from PBS recounts that deeply disturbing, heart-wrenching chronicle.

This historical documentary takes a look at the Japanese developments during World War in the field of submarine technology, sharing their plans for the landmark I-401 aircraft carrier submarine with the US only after coming perilously close to handing it over to Soviet powers.

Prime Minister Winston Churchill's order for the British navy to attack the French navy in 1940 is recalled, including what led to the assault and the assault itself. Included are eyewitness accounts from British and French sailors, unclassified communications between Churchill and FDR, and notes from British War Cabinet meetings.

A thorough account of the fierce, seven-month Battle of Stalingrad, a bloody WWII conflict between German and Russian troops that resulted in more than a million casualties. The program includes archival footage, information gleaned from the Russian archives, and interviews with military historians, veterans of the battle and Sergei Khrushchev, the son of Nikita Khrushchev, who at the time served on Soviet premier Joseph Stalin's military council.

This episode of PBS's popular "Secrets of the Dead" documentary series revisits a scandalous chain of events that transpired in the 1970s - when East German female athletes soared ahead of their competitors at the Olympics and other events, justly raising suspicions of widespread steroid use. The suspicions were rooted in a cold and hard reality, though one far more sweeping and organized than many thought possible: in an attempt to gain superiority and an edge on its international competitors in sporting events, the East German government had set up and implemented a program of systematically "doping" its female athletes with performance-enhancing drugs. Years later, an estimated 10% or more of these victims contracted cancer in middle age. Secrets of the Dead: Doping for Gold explores the contours of this scandal and discusses its implications for the late Cold War and for today's athletic participants.

This documentary explores what scientists now believe caused the destruction of Minoan civilization almost five thousand years ago. Experts believed a tsunami destroyed the cities built by people that many believe to be the first Europeans to use a written language. Some believe these events may have provided the impetus for the creation of the myth of Atlantis.

Dr. Hawley Harvey Crippen was convicted of murdering his wife, and his punishment was execution. Like other victims of capital punishment, DNA and forensic work later revealed that he was entirely innocent of the crime. What makes this case of particular interest is the fact that the Dr.'s execution occurred in 1910. This documentary presents this new evidence in the case, and makes the argument that turn-of-the-century justice may be full of unjustly convicted people like Crippen.

The salvaging of the Queen Anne's Revenge, the flagship of early 18th-century pirate Blackbeard, from its watery grave off the North Carolina coast is chronicled. The process enables researchers to determine whether, as legend has it, the pirate purposely ran the ship aground in order to cheat its crew out of booty from a blockade of Charleston, S.C. Included are remarks from marine archaeologist Lisa Briggs; author Angus Konstam (Blackbeard) and David Moore (North Carolina Maritime Museum).

When the remains of over 400 mutilated bodies were unearthed in Mexico, historians were at a complete loss at how to explain such a grim discovery. In this documentary, filmmakers question everything we ever thought we knew about this ancient civilization by offering a compelling new take on the violent relationships between the central Aztecs and the Conquistadors.

It marks an odd and intriguing footnote to the Second World War: liberation-linked discoveries aside, the world attained much of its knowledge about what happened in Auschwitz from two concentration camp prisoners, Alfred Wetzler and Rudolph Vrba, who escaped from that hellhole and determined to reveal the breadth and depth of the brutality they had witnessed to Allied nations and officials. After commandeering a miraculous escape from the said death penitentiary, Vrba and Wetzler prepared a 32-page document known as the Vrba-Wetzler Report and promptly delivered it to Allied officials - thereby saving the lives of countless potential victims. In the process, however, Hungarian ruler Miklós Horthy deliberately withheld this information from his countrymen for a lengthy period. To no one's surprise, this stirred up massive degrees of controversy and dissent. The documentary Secrets of the Dead: Escape from Auschwitz details this remarkable series of events via interviews, archival footage and commentary.

One of history's most thrilling and seldom-told wartime stories unfolded in the summer of '42, when a Japanese pilot and an American fighter pilot squared off, head-to-head, in the skies above Guadalcanal. The Japanese pilot gunned down the American, who nonetheless miraculously escaped from the crash unharmed and made his way, undetected, through enemy territory. The PBS documentary Secrets of the Dead: Dogfight Over Guadalcanal resurrects this visceral, gut-wrenching series of events, step by step, via narrative readings of accounts from each of the men's diaries and a thrilling journey to the recently discovered and excavated American plane - which, astonishingly, still rests at its crash site many decades later.

The dangers faced by religious reformers and those who translated the Bible into English are examined in this compelling episode. Actor Liev Schreiber narrates this chilling account of the efforts of theologian John Wycliffe, scholar William Tyndale and Archbishop of Canterbury Thomas Cranmer to produce Bibles in English that included their own interpretations of the Scriptures. Included are comments from Claremont Graduate University English and history professor Lori Anne Ferrell.
